name: Avoid having class methods without scope modifiers - Symfony STD (PHP)
description:
This rules verifies that class method have scope modifiers.

The visibility of method can be defined by prefixing the declaration with the keywords public, protected or private. Class methods declared public can be accessed everywhere. Methods declared protected can be accessed only within the class itself and by inherited classes. Methods declared as private may only be accessed by the class that defines the Method.

Class Methods must be defined as public, private, or protected.
output: PHP class methods not having scope modifiers.
